title: Lesson 48
paragraph: This lesson focuses on freedom and rights, covering autonomy, sovereignty, and individual liberties.

words.meaning: the ability to govern oneself or make independent decisions
supreme power or authority over a state
words.example: The country maintained its sovereignty despite external pressures.

words.meaning: the act of being set free from restrictions
words.example: The emancipation of slaves was a historic milestone.

words.meaning: the act of setting someone free from confinement or control
words.example: The liberation of the city ended years of occupation.

words.meaning: granting the right to vote or participate in governance
the right to make one’s own choices or govern oneself
words.example: The people demanded self-determination for their territory.

words.meaning: the power of using one's will
words.example: She left the company of her own volition.

words.meaning: freedom from control or influence of others
the expression of disagreement or opposition
words.example: Citizens voiced dissent against the new law.

words.meaning: a special right or privilege exclusive to an individual or group
words.example: Voting is a prerogative of every citizen.
